constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 190 (Thursday, October 28, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. HUFFMAN:
H.R. 5775.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, Section 8, Clause 1: The Congress shall have
Power to lay and collect Taxes, Duties, Impost and Excises;
to pay the Debts and provide for the common Defense and
general Welfare of the United States; but all Duties, Imposts
and Excises shall be uniform throughout the United States.
Article I, Section 8, Clause 3: To regulate Commerce with
foreign Nations, and among the several States, and with the
Indian Tribes.
[Page H6034]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Financial Services, and in addition to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

title: Sustainable International Financial Institutions Act of 2021
